org.jbpm.instance.migration
Interface DynamicMigration

public interface DynamicMigration

Defines the interface for a dynamic Migration Class. Classes that implement this interface are responsible for determining the destination node in the new process. Instances of this class are invoked at runtime by the Migrator class.

You declare a dynamic migration in the StateNodeMap returned by your Migration implementation. The class name is declared using the syntax java://com.some.DynamicMigrationImplementation.

For example:

public class SomeProcessInstanceMigration implements org.jbpm.instance.migration.Migration{ public StateNodeMap createNodeMap() { return new StateNodeMap( new String[][] {{"deprecatedNode1", "java://com.some.DynamicMigrationImplementation"}}); } }

Author:
Caleb Powell

          Given the deprecatedNodeName and the oldProcessInstance, this method is responsible for returning the currentNodeName.
